0.92 W/kg (head), 1.23 W/kg (body)Samsung Galaxy S5: 5.59 x 2.85 x 0.32 in, 145 gm, 1080 x 1920 pixels, 5.1 in, 432 ppi, 2 GB RAM, microSD upto 128 GB!, Qualcomm Snapdragon 801, MSM8974-AC Processor: Quad core, 2500 MHz, Krait 400, 0.63 W/kg (head), 0.82 W/kg (body)Samsung Galaxy S4 (Intl version): 5.38 x 2.75 x 0.31 in, 130 gm, 1080 x 1920 pixels, 5.0 in, 441 ppi, 2 GB RAM, microSD, up to 64 GB, 13 MP/2MP, Exynos 5 Octa 5410 CPU, Quad-core 1.6 GHz Cortex-A15 & quad-core 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7, 0.85 W/kg (head), 1.55 W/kg (body)HTC One M8: 5.76 x 2.78 x 0.37 in, 160 gm, 1080 x 1920 pixels, 5 in, 441 ppi, 2 GB RAM, microSD upto 128 GB!, 4 MP (rear), 5 MP(front for selfies), Qualcomm Snapdragon 801, Quad core, 2300 MHz, Krait 400, 0.94 W/kg (head), 0.83 W/kg (body)LG G2: 5.45 x 2.79 x 0.35 in, 143 gm, 1080 x 1920 pixels, 5.2 in, 424 ppi, 2 GB RAM, no ext Storage, 13 MP/2.1 MP, Qualcomm MSM8974 Snapdragon 800, Quad-core 2.26 GHz Krait 400, 0.50 W/kg (head), 0.69 W/kg (body)Apple iPhone 5S: 4.87 x 2.31 x 0.30 in, 112gm, 640 x 1136 pixels, 4.0 in, 326 ppi, 1 GB RAM, no ext storage, 8 MP/1.2 MP, Apple A7, Dual-core 1.3 GHz Cyclone (ARM v8-based), 1.12 W/kg (head), 1.18 W/kg (body)Nokia Lumia 1520: 6.41 x 3.36 x 0.34 in, 209gm, 1080 x 1920 pixels, 6.0 in, 367 ppi, 2 GB RAM, microSD up to 64 GB, 20 MP/1.2MP, Qualcomm MSM8974 Snapdragon 800 CPU Quad-core 2.2 GHz Krait 400, SAR: 0.59 W/kg (head), 0.24 W/kg (body)Motorola Moto G: 5.11 x 2.59 x 0.46 in, 143 gm, 720 x 1280 pixels, 4.5 in, 326 ppi, 1 GB RAM, no ext storage, 5 MP/1.3 MP, Qualcomm Snapdragon 400, Quad-core 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7, SAR: 1.17 W/kg (head), 1.06 W/kg (body)Given the above key specs, my suggestion to my friends is to choose 2 or 3 KEY features you require (may be large screen size, maybe less weight, maybe more CPU power) and then start nailing down the phones. Definitely and definitely go to a phone or a big box store and feel the phone. Nothing replaces that. In the end end you are using it for days and years, so the tactile feel is very important.Ask questions, the review cannot do justice to Galaxy Note III. I will be glad to answer any questions.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: thomass275
Reviews.Content: So far so good!  I've had this phone for a couple of months now and it is head and shoulders above the previous phone I had (Samsung Skyrocket).  Battery lasts all day with plenty left over (I use it constantly through out the day).  It's responsive to my touch and with the S pen.  I'm still learning everything it can do so I'll have to add to this post at a later date when I figure it all out.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: thomass275
Reviews.Content: So far so good!  I've had this phone for a couple of months now and it is head and shoulders above the previous phone I had (Samsung Skyrocket).  Battery lasts all day with plenty left over (I use it constantly through out the day).  It's responsive to my touch and with the S pen.  I'm still learning everything it can do so I'll have to add to this post at a later date when I figure it all out.

Reviews.Title: Good phone on a contract
Reviews.Author: L. Khalilova
Reviews.Content: I'm on AT&T; contract, so when it came time to upgrade I got this gorgeous phone. The only downside is locked bootloader. But ROM devs still came thru with rooting and some international ROMs are ported. So freedom is still there. Rooting allows me to remove some unneeded programs and also save some battery with Greenify app - to gain full control of my phone in other words.Other thoughts: if you are looking for contract free phone with big screen and GPE like experience and unlocked bootloader - look at Sony Xperia Z Ultra or Samsung Galaxy Note3 for T-Mobile.

Reviews.Title: NOTE 3
Reviews.Author: SHANE
Reviews.Content: This is THE best cell I have owned. It has endless features. The note feature is great for jotting down things one would usually have to have pen and paper for. The size is wonderful. Don't hesitate you will love it.

Reviews.Title: Huge but efficient
Reviews.Author: Shaneka Joy
Reviews.Content: Awesome phone! Battery life is noticeably sustainable on a busy day with no recharge necessary. It is difficult to have a conversation putting it up to your ear so headphones or bluetooth earpiece is a must. The phone is huge but manageable once you get used to it. Fast and responsive. Does everything a phone and a tablet was made to do...LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: my note
Reviews.Author: Julie Simek
Reviews.Content: i received this a few days ago and have been working with it, it is big but i really like it, lots of new things to learn about it, but i cant wait to see what i discover next that this phone can do.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic phone
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a fantastic phone.  There will be more weight in your pocket but after several weeks it's hardly noticeable.  A fantastic size it forced me to sell my now unused tablet.  Android apps and web browsing won't strain your eyes like on old phones and allow you to be "drawn in" to what your doing, rather than thinking how it would be better served by a larger device, like PC or tablet.Overall if your a web browser and heavy app user, this is the phone for you.  It serves this purpose so well.  If not you might want to look into something smaller.

Reviews.Title: Super with Caveat
Reviews.Author: Michael K. O'connor
Reviews.Content: I've had this for several weeks. It's a high performer in every way.The GPS issue: it receives GPS signal like a champ.I am editing my review after having this a few more weeks. I expected to have GPS dropping problems because of the many reviews and blogs I had seen mentioning it, so I mentioned that problem in my review. But to be fair, after weeks of testing, the GPS and online navigation works very well and I see no need to use the workarounds mentioned in those forums and blogs.Either they have fixed the problem with the newer phones software, or the trigger for the problem which seems to have to do with switching from one type of data connection to another while on the move (i.e. LTE to 4g or different towers or w/e)does not occur in my area. I have ATT and live in San Diego County and I drive for a living. I used the GPS to navigate to about 20 addresses a few days ago over an 8 hour period of time. Not only did it get me there and never drop signal, but the battery lasted me all day (I did turn the screen off when I it wasn't needed and listened to audio instructions so the screen was only on 50% of the time). It saved my but when my normal navigator, a garmin, had nowhere to plug into in the vehicle I checked out that day.So basically this phone is spectacular and the only potential flaw I heard about doesn't affect my phone or my area. I bought this from Amazon online.Databyter

Reviews.Title: Note 3
Reviews.Author: R Gary Bateman
Reviews.Content: The Galaxy Note Three is proof that size does matter. After years of suffering with an iPhone Five and Apples failing operating system, I have found the Galaxy Note Three to be a breath of fresh air. The greatest aspect of this phone has got to be the battery life. The battery, which is as large as some smart phones, allows a full day of calling, texting, gaming, internet browsing, and movie watching, without the need of a recharge. For someone who had to recharge their phone twice a day with their old phone, the long lasting battery life is reason enough to make the switch to Samsung. Another feature that sets the Galaxy Note Three apart from the competition is it’s larger sized high definition screen.  The screens images are so crystal clear that they rival the picture quality of high definition computer monitors and televisions. The Galaxy Note Three’s larger screen size has also proved to be a major convenience. With the larger dimensions, one can easily show video and photographs to a group of friends without having to pass your phone around from person to person. This eliminates the concern of damage caused if  your phone is dropped. With all the large benefits that set the Galaxy Note Three apart from other phones on the market, Samsung also added in several small features that separate this phone from all others. When you are texting, the phone vibrates every time you touch a key. These small vibrations causes the touchscreen to feel like an actual keypad, rather than a piece of glass. Another small feature of the Galaxy Note Three is the ability to change from song to song on the MP3 player by passing an open hand over the touchscreen. This feature may not have world changing value, but feeling like a Jedi Knight, even if only for a moment, can never be underestimated.  With all the positive points of the Galaxy Note Three, there are also a few drawbacks. The phone comes with several apps that serve the same function which makes the interface somewhat confusing. The settings menu is nearly impossible to navigate because of TouchWiz, which is so broken they had to add a search bar so that users could type in what they are looking for. There are also a few concerns about the construction of the phone.  The sheer size of the phones screen makes it fragile to the point that a drop will most probably end in the screen shattering. This problem is compounded by the plastic exterior of the phone which provides little rigidity or protection. With a price of two hundred dollars to replace a damaged screen, the fragility of the Galaxy Note Three is by far the greatest concern to an otherwise stellar product. If you are a person that loves the most advanced technology, and are willing to spend the money on a good phone case, I would recommend the Galaxy Note Three as your next phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone. Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Gomez
Reviews.Content: Received in perfect condition. Completely satisfied. Large screen with great resolution. Good battery life. Easy to set up. I wishe it came with earphones and protector case.

Reviews.Title: The best smart phone yet!
Reviews.Author: Roryrob
Reviews.Content: This is by far, the best smart phone that I have ever owned. The display is amazing and the processor is mad fast. The camera is very good and the call quality is nice too. It seemed huge at first, but after a few days other phone seem tiny. I am a true fan!

Reviews.Title: More than expected
Reviews.Author: Joyce Edington
Reviews.Content: I am and will be discovering what this phone can do for some time.  I write, it converts to text, reads back what I've written in a  proper female English voice.  I thought the old clunker it replaced was good but the Samsung Galaxy Note 3 is great.

Reviews.Title: Shiny new toys loose their luster eventually...
Reviews.Author: Heather G. "Heather"
Reviews.Content: We held onto the iPhone 4's for a while. They were small, simple, and while we did not particular care for Apple restricting your ability to do anything to it, it suited our needs.When we traded up for the Samsung Note III, we were of course in awe of the shiny new toy. It had a great screen, did all sorts of neat things (drawing on your screen, voice texting, ect) that made us go "Oooooo." The battery life is amazing. I fiddle with some games when I'm bored, watch youtube videos every now and then, surf the web, respond to e-mails, text - and after a full day of being uncharged (14 hours later) , I still have 47% battery life. I once let it go uncharged for 2 days and it was still at 19% and kicking. The low battery alarm doesn't start going off until 11%.A few cons though...1) Don't get a case. Atleast not the small thin wallet type by ULAK that I got. I love the case. Don't get me wrong. Its perfect for making sure I don't scratch my phone while it is tossed and thrown around in my purse of mysteries. The phone certainly is big enough to find in a stack. However - it makes for taking actual phone calls to your ear rather difficult, as its a big phone, and the case only adds to it. I use speakerphone alot - which works great by the way. I can talk from across the room from where the phone is and am still heard clearly (I'm not a yeller).2) Don't bother with the gorilla glass/whatever screen protector they try to sell you at the AT&T; store for the phone. It's $30 something dollars. Both both got one thinking itd be a neat way to protect our phones. Its only been a month, and my husbands is already peeling up at the corners and mine collects 'dirt' at the edges when I'm never around anything dirty and then gets under the sticky so I can't get it out. To me - its not worth the money if its already wearing down so fast from light everyday use. It is pretty clear though for the screen - like its not there!3) The auto-correct is the bane of my existing. I consider myself a very skilled phone typer. On my iphone, I could type out paragraphs without ever looking at my screen half the time and it typed out perfectly. Autocorrected to just the right word each time. The Note III makes up words for me I never input, or have never heard of. I am CONSTANTLY correcting the auto-correct. Whether I use the stylus or my fingers on the keyboard. No matter how slow I take it or fast I go, it never puts exactly what I want. I guess this is why they push the voice-text feature so much on this phone, and didn't put as much development into the old T9 methods of auto correct. This is my biggest frustration. The phone is supposed to 'learn' how you type, but apparently isn't as smart as the iphone who can keep up with my typing skills. (I am not a Apple lover so it pains me to compliment it).Otherwise, its fine until my next trade up.

Reviews.Title: The note 3 is the best phone I've tried!
Reviews.Author: Michael Harris
Reviews.Content: Amazing resolution, great battery life, great features, light for the size.  It does everything I want it to do like make it easy to type because I have hand problems I can appreciate it.  Numbers always on the screen is real helpful.

Reviews.Content: I love the battery life, the great screen, and the features. I hate the size. It is just a little too big. I wanted something bigger than the s4 but not quite this big. Other than that it is the best phone I have ever owned.

Reviews.Content: The note series of phones are the best phones out there right now. I love my new Note 3 is the Awesomest

It's like they want us to void our warranty or something. Hmm?

Reviews.Title: The phone that's really a computer.
Reviews.Author: D. Ross "Lil' Ross"
Reviews.Content: This thing is so fast it puts my laptop to shame.  (Samsung R580 core i5).  At least, it sure seems that way.  That may be because it surfs the mobile web sites.  Anyway, to get to the point this phone is a speed demon.  It has so many customizable features you can personalize it almost any way you like.  Wallpapers, passkeys, lock screen tags, app arrangement, voice recognition, it's all here and then some.  If the screen size bothers you, simply enable "one handed operation" mode (be sure to check every box under the menu so it functions across all apps and screens), do a quick swipe of your finger from right to left and back to right, and the screen shrinks down to a customizable box that can be operated much like a smaller cell phone!  It can even recognize when you're looking at the screen or not and shut itself off or pause vids accordingly.  The battery is huge and has lasted me all day.  It's very thin and light.  4g LTE service is the fastest i've seen on a phone.  I switched to At&t; from Sprint specifically so I can get the most out of this device.  Sprint never had 4g in the 3 years that I owned my previous phone, the Epic 4G, even though I paid for "premium data".  In my area, (Central Louisiana), At&t; delivers.  Sucks that data is not unlimited and my monthly plan costs more, though.  I have only tapped the surface of what this phone can do.  The camera is amazing.  Video is amazingly sharp and it picks up sound very well.  I saw posts that image stabilization for video was not included but I'm pretty sure it actually is on this model.  There is a tab that says smart stabilization when I recorded vids for the first time and I enabled it and seemed to notice a difference.  I haven't even tried the 4k resolution yet and I am blown away.  Coming from a first generation Galaxy phone to this is truly a worthwhile upgrade.  Basically, it's like carrying a very capable desktop computer in your pocket.  The phone is quite large, but I got used to it in a couple of days.  The swype function is better than ever and even more responsive.  It fulfills the main things I planned to use it for...watching youtube and netflix and recording sharp video.  As time goes on it can evolve to meet any other needs i may have of it.  It's good for business use or fun.  It's like I got a great camera, video camera, web browser, phone, computer and gaming machine all in one!  I plan to get the Smart Trade 2 year warranty from amazon to cover this baby.  As of now I am protecting it with a Bodyguardz screen cover (highly recommended and sold on amazon as well) and an Incipio phone case.  If you're gonna spend the dough for this thing you may as well get some decent protection and coverage.

Reviews.Title: Love it, but it does have some problems.
Reviews.Author: Wtran
Reviews.Content: I am a total techie. I love new gadgets and gizmos, and I WILL read the manual before I tinker with it. I'm the type of person that would want to maximize the experience and total functionality of a product, because why else would anyone buy a $708 phone (from ATT)?Despite my love for the phone, there are some problems. Let me start off with the innumerable PROS.The screen resolution is absolutely breathtaking. Clear crisp colors combined with unbeatable brightness. I was actually able to see what I was working on while I was walking outside on a really sunny day (on auto-brightness), which is really saying something. None of my other phones were able to adjust so well.The sound quality and loudness were a definite plus for me. It is not boom box/stereo loud, but for the phone that it is, it does pack quite a punch.Call quality has definitely been clear and crisp, which is surprising because I've been in areas where the signal hasn't been perfect.  I haven't experienced any static or issues at all.The S Pen experience itself, is worth the Note 3 purchase. The feedback from interaction between the screen and pen is really nice. Smooth writing with a 'real' like quality writing. Note-taking or jotting is a joy especially on such a big screen like the Note 3. The S Pen also has a button that when clicked, would pop up a menu option for other things the pen can do (scrapbooking, taking notes, etc).  It is really nice and convenient. I have used my Adonit Jot Pro stylus on my iPad to play candy crush, and even that was nothing compared to playing candy crush with the S Pen. The feedback is great!I love the widgets they have available, it makes all of my planning and day-to-day life easier. With an iCloud calendar sync app, the calendar widget makes planning my day/week/month much easier now that it's so big on the home screen. It is really customizable and the amount of widgets now available (compared to what I had on the S2) is mind-boggling.I love how Samsung was able to actually improve and grow. They have now added an assistive light widget (so we don't have to go to third party apps for a flashlight), and they have a notification settings where you can customize the main settings you have access to (8), while still being able to access them all. Features like: power saving, NFC, S Beam, Multi-tasking, Air plane mode, Bluetooth, are all great, it's nice to be able to choose what you want.The phone itself is fast and this is substantiated by the fact that you can multi-task now. I was able to google/email and netflix all at the same time. Now if that isn't fast and smooth, I don't know what is.The lock screen is much more customizable now, and that's great because I can include my email (for if I were to lose/misplace my phone) while showing my individual flair.I like visual voicemail a lot as well. It saves a lot of time and hassle sitting impatiently as you listen to the message and try to figure out who left it. With visual voicemail, you can play it, manually fast forward or rewind, see how long the message is, who left it, and even a button to call them back. No more need to sit there and wait a whole minute to hear "press seven to delete...press blah blah to hear more options."Now, there's still room for improvement. I have a lot of Apple products simply because of its convenience and ease of use. They have their fair share of problems. In comparison to Siri, S Voice is not as smooth in operation. Despite my best attempts to loudly articulate my wishes and desires, it often times repeats back the most ridiculous things. I do appreciate the fact that you can open apps with S Voice (this has long been established, but still appreciated).  S Voice is nice, but there's still room for improvement.Camera. I keep having to remind myself that this phone is not an iPhone (they invest solely on their camera). The Note 3's camera is not as great as the iPhone's, I must admit. But it is relatively good and intuitive. I think the closest thing you can get to iPhone quality is the 'Rich Tone (HDR)' option which boosts the colors. I took several pictures and videos to test run the quality and I wasn't that impressed. The camera auto focuses while you record so you can actually see process of focusing while you're recording, which is distracting. As a result, only one area of focus can targeted at a time. I haven't taken portraits or group shots, so I don't know how this will work out, but I guess I'll have to wait and see. Besides the camera quality, I'm really giddy about the modes they have offered. Sports shots, panorama, 360 shots, best shots, they're all nice and I'm excited for a chance to try them out!Now, the meh. Despite the phone being almost absolutely amazing, I started running into some problems that I found out other people were experiencing as well. Email. My email kept lagging/freezing and logged itself out. It would not authenticate. It worked after several tries, only to have the same issue again. I somehow fixed it only to run into the error 'Email not responding,' forcing the app to close.  This is annoying because it seems to occur almost every time I received an incoming email. People across the internet have suggested unmounting the microSD card and using a new one, but despite doing this and even removing the card completely, the problem is still occurring. As a result, other apps have been 'glitchy' as well. The transitions between apps haven't been as flawlessly impeccable as I've seen. I'm going to tinker with it some more before I do a hard reset.I definitely recommend this phone. I saved up the whole sum to purchase this phone straight from the get go and don't regret it. A bit disappointed about the technical problems, but other than that, it's working swell!

Reviews.Title: Superb.
Reviews.Author: fkosorski
Reviews.Content: After looking forward to this phone for a very long time, I finally received it. I am very pleased. It did its best to meet expectations. I suppose I just wasn't blown away.

Reviews.Title: an excellent smart phone
Reviews.Author: Walter C Bradshaw
Reviews.Content: Great for those who text or surf the net as well as talk on the phone.  Users manual online only, no headset provide which would be nice to listen to media and other things so everyone else is not listening to your stuff or so yo can here better. New mini plug not sure why that is necessary.

Reviews.Title: Seems nice but mine has problems
Reviews.Author: W. Paulsen "bp"
Reviews.Content: I've used this phone for a few hours after activating and getting an update installed. But the phone has already frozen up two times, requiring me to hold the button on the right side for several seconds until a restart. No, I did not install any new apps, the phone froze up when I was trying to read email.  And then the phone often freezes for a few seconds while doing simple navigation, but then continues.  (No, I was not watching a movie or listening to music.) Maybe it's a hardware defect? Also, there's so much bloat/crap-wear that's difficult to remove, or can't be removed, and some can't be disabled completely (like My Magazine) - and those consume data bandwidth. And I thought with all the processing power that this device claims to have, the UI would be snappier. Instead it's only very slightly faster that my previous iPhone 4s with IOS-7.  And with IOS-6 this Note 3 is slower.  I've seen older Android phone and they are sooo slow, compared to iPhones - I think those who say this phone is fast are just comparing it to older Androids. But the screen is a nice size, and without a case and protector it feels cheaply made, unlike iPhones which seem more solid. (But I'm sure others have dropped and broken their iPhones.)  If the phone continues to occasionally freeze up and the phone needs to be replaced I'll update this review.

Reviews.Title: AT&T; GPS issues turn this amazing phone into one of complete frustration.
Reviews.Author: Howlrunner
Reviews.Content: CONS:AT&T; has had over 4 months to get their software GPS issues fixed with this phone. If you plan on using this for navigation in any form, AVOID IT UNTIL THEY FIX THE PROBLEM! Google Maps, Ingress, WAZE and even AT&T;'s paid Navigation app will NOT be reliable. Just search "AT&T; NOTE 3 GPS Issues" to learn more. As much as I love the phone in general, the fact that a MAJOR function of this phone has been broken for over 4 months is ridiculous.Think about it for a minute. 20% of the lifespan of this $300 phone has been without a functional GPS. This is one of the top of the line phones for AT&T; and yet they have been unable to resolve the issue. People have resorted to rooting their phone, copying Samsung's default GPS files over AT&T;'s files to get a functional GPS. If you aren't willing to void your warranty, well then you're out of luck.If GPS matters to you, avoid it.pros:- Huge screen- S-Pen- Long battery life- Blazing fast- Almost everything honestlyGreat phone. Sucky support. Avoid if you use GPS for anything. =(

Reviews.Title: Once u go Note u realize ur phone is dope!
Reviews.Author: sjmslik
Reviews.Content: for those unfamiliar w/ dope, its a slang term that means ur awesome.I cant believe there arent more reviews. Anyways this is the sweet spot for phone size. once u get this size phone u realize 2 things:1. u cant ever go bigger than this, its just not practical and2. u cant ever go smaller than this, it just wont be the same enjoyable experiencemy decision to go to this size was i just though about how many actual instances in 1 day i use my phone and realized it was a ton. It just made since to not go cheap with something that i use so frequently. these phones really are becoming our little companions that do so much and more every day.You get used to the size quickly. i have small hands and i adapted very easily. the phone has settings to make it easier to use 1 handed for common things so that you dont have to reach inches away to press a number or something.The speed is incredible. Browsing the web is super fast and the batter life, omg, i can FINALLY have a LIVE WALLPAPER running all day and not worry about running out of battery before i charge up at night. Battery is simply amazing.spen is fun but i wished the button on it acted like a mouse click all the time. it does on a few things but not most.thats all for now, i dont regret my purchase and knew i wouldnt, now if otterbox would just finally release there commuter case i will be good to go.

Reviews.Title: I'm really pissed at the moment
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: .L.but maybe after I cool off a bit I will revise my review.  The Note 3 I purchased was supposed to be new.  The box it arrived in had been previously opened.  The box was torn up on the inside and the ear buds are missing. The phone seems fine.  I haven't even turned it on yet.  Many may say that I'm being too picky...but s*** like this really bothers me.  I paid over $800.00 for this phone!  I should get exactly what I paid for!10/13/2013Okay I had some time to calm down. And thanks to a response to my review I have been made aware that AT&T; repackages there phones and remove the ear buds.  Sorry for griping about nothing.  I have upgraded this phone from 3 stars to a much deserved 5 stars.  This phone kicks butt! My favorite features are the big brilliant display and the s pen. I just can't put this thing down. I can't find anything wrong with this phone other than the enormous amounts of bloatware. But, most cell phone have this problem. I highly recommend this phone. It's a beast! You will love it. the hardware specs on this phones are so impressive that it will remain relevant for at least the next two years.

Reviews.Title: GPS Issue Samsung Galaxy Note 3 AT&T; Version
Reviews.Author: Gadget Guy
Reviews.Content: This phone is all you would think so I won't go into that here.  But there is a significant GPS issue for the AT&T; version.Every time I plug or unplug the charger from my phone the GPS drops out. I have to then toggle the GPS on/off in my quick settings to get it working again while navigatingIt also seems to drop the signal when I get an incoming phone call or open any other app while using the navigation app.I have confirmed this same behavior on 2 other friends Note 3's. I'm hoping this is just a software issue that will be fixed in a future os update.

Reviews.Title: Makes me fuzzy
Reviews.Author: Brandon Smith
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone! It makes me happy and all fuzzy inside. It does everything I ask it to. Also, it gets be laid.

Reviews.Title: Note 3 is A ok with me!
Reviews.Author: David D Pearson
Reviews.Content: I have had the note 2 and now the note 3. I love the new technology Samsung comes up with! Easy to use and great features.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: JHANSON
Reviews.Content: Great phone. Easy to use.Size makes this phone much easer to see .Would make this purchase again. Being able to write on the phone is it best feature.

Reviews.Title: great wonderful phone, cool
Reviews.Author: greg foltz
Reviews.Content: does everything i want my phone to do. + more things to make life easiermake sure to get protective cover for it.

Reviews.Title: Best Phone out there
Reviews.Author: Miguel Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Super fast shipper wow incredible but this phone is what I want and more you can do whatever you want with this wonder its incredible

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: L. Myers
Reviews.Content: This phone has everything and the kitchen sink. Power, Battery Life, Beautiful Large Screen, and Stylus. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: I will not be going back to Apple anytime soon - Love this phone
Reviews.Author: Larry Roberts
Reviews.Content: I could write and write and write about this phone. It is one of the most amazing phones I have ever owned. The amount of options and clarity are unreal. The Note 3 is pure perfection.FEB 19, 2014 UPDATE:I have returned my Note 3 and will now be going to Iphone 5S. The GPS on this phone is pure junk. It does not matter where you are or what carrier your with. For what is now listed over $700.00 on Amazon I would expect the GPS to work. I am amazed that Amazon has hiked the price of this phone since I purchased it by over $100.00! I also started to have freeze ups and it would require removing the battery to fix it. I don't know why but it always seems that with Android phones they start off great and quickly degrade in performance and the Note 3 is no exception. This makes me sad because I really do love the size. Well it's a love/hate I guess. In any case, I will be moving back once again to Apple and the iPhone. Small screen, yes - but it's a trade off for ensured quality. This phones price currently on Amazon is not worth it with all the issues.

Reviews.Title: Depends on your exact needs
Reviews.Author: TX Buyer
Reviews.Content: I love this phone.. well made, great screen.. you can customize however you like.  As a small tablet, it can't be beat. I bought it because it's the only one with a built in note taking app.. which is very useful to me.. couple of major pitfalls however killed the dal for me:As a phone, it's useless - one handed dialing is not possible unless you have Andre the giant sized hands.. i even used a really cool feature that moves the keypad to the right part of the screen for right handed users. you have a press a favorite contact twice before it dialsvoice command.. well, it's not very good and can't access it unlockedphotos - you have to unlock the phone, then click the camera app - too many steps and you lose that kodak momentbattery life - no better or worse than other phones.. i require a bright sceen so it's never been a good possibility for mePros- awesome screen you can watch a movie on it and it's great- lots of real estate on the screens- widgets are way better than simple apps- open system means lots of flexibility- thinness of device, weight too- big screen lets you actually see what's on your calendar - that was very nicei had real hope for this but it failed me on a recent business trip.. voice recognition, making calls, one handed operation gave me carpal tunnel.. so i'm returning it.I'm certain it will bring many users much happiness.. but it depends on how you use it

Reviews.Title: Charging issues
Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: I've had 4 of these phones. I keep returning it because the charger won't work. Took it to the store, they say it's the phone not the cord. But every phone I get sent as a replacement has the exact same issue. The charger works on their phone in the store, so they say it isn't the cord but how can every single phone have the same issue? I regret buying this phone. Out a crap-load of money and the damn thing won't charge.

Reviews.Title: Very fragile, be extra careful!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Mashimaro
Reviews.Content: I had the phone only about a week when it slipped out and hid the ground as I was about to get out of my car. Even with the phone protector on, the internal screen cracked. The outer glass is fine. The screen blacked out, even though the phone is still running, but I can't see a thing!  Both AT&T;  and Samsung refused to take the phone back nor fixing it for me, so I am stuck with a piece of broken plastic. Called a local phone repair store, was told I need to pay $350 at least to fix it because the note 3 is a new phone and they have to get the part from overseas.In sum, the phone is very fast, and big screen is nice too. The body of phone is cheap plastic and has a fake plastic leather back. My advise, if you want this phone, do purchase insurance, which cost you $6 a month. I seriously doubt the craftsmanship of this phone. In the past 4 years, I have had iphone and HTC phones, both were dropped countless times, they were all fine. I only drop this Note 3 for once like 15 inches fall with the protector on, and it is totally broken. In the end, I bought a HTC One with some discount from AT&T.;

Reviews.Title: Make sure you GPS is working immediately.  Appears to be a hardware defect on some.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Major GPS problems, apparently GPS problems - appear to be a hardware problem on some phones.  See http://goo.gl/PaIx3V for details.Otherwise this is a great phone and worth noting AT&T; shipped me a replacement and it works great so far.Also, worth noting, a rude gesture towards Amazon for not supporting Text to Speech in kindle on amazon and for not supporting video and Amazon Instant Video on Android when it IS supported on Kindle which runs android.  Basically they have pushed me to purchase books on google and video on vudu.  I assume this is not what they intended.More details:Note 3 - this is long:a. wanted to only carry 1 device, not phone, iPad, and a kindle.  To do that it means I am starting to buy books from google or convert from kindle to google.  This is for a very specific use case - I find it valuable to have text spoken to me as I read technical or other non-fiction books.  I need to try the general screen readers as well.  Mostly it is less good at this use case then I wanted.b. I chose to invite complexity of android into my life by getting a Note.  I would recommend android to almost no one.c. If you choose android give up any pretense of privacy.  You have none.  Stuff I did on my phone began showing up on my laptop searches.  I now use tor router, a limited keyboard and duckduckgo for much of my day to day work.  Check out google play guardian project apps for a bit more privacy.I believe iPhone and Windows Phone are superior in almost every way.  For me solving the myriad problems of it was a way to refocus on a consumer product and technology in general.c. A consumer should not have to go hunting for a podcast player (pick your favorite standard feature,) nor should they then have to download 4 which each have radically different UI's to pick their favorite.d. NO ONE should have to use touchwiz (sorry, I got a hairball just thinking about it. )e. It is huge.f. Mine appears to have a gps defect, new one arrives today or monday.g. Every useful app wants access to everything about me they can findh. bluetooth stereo fails in my car so most of the voice features fail for me - bloody heck, my iPhone 4 worked better!And yet, I find it works well for me.Best I can tell it is for a series of reasons - *'s next to the ones that are strongest:*a. Email while less pretty works well and has a titer by unread mode which i like.*b. Being able to read all the events on the calendar in month view is glorious.*c. Nova Launcher makes me happy (without this I would have returned it due to touchwiz)*d. The battery just keeps goinge. being able to swap keyboards is nice*f. After a month I began actually using the stylus.  For note taking in meetings it is less obtrusive and works very well.*g. the large screen is glorioush. I have become a fan of todotxt(.com) and it works well here*i.  I loved that I could try 70 GTD todolist apps till I found one that i likej. evernote and last pass work well.*k. multiwindow is AWESOME**l. widgets rock (tip of the hat to Nokia Symbian for this idea.)*m. dolphin browsern. google now, though a privacy nightmare, is very coolThings that would make it perfect: 1. if i get screen reader working to read just when i want, 2. if I could get it to read and let me respond to email.

Reviews.Title: Needs the Boot Loader Unlocked
Reviews.Author: John Blair "President, BlairWare Inc."
Reviews.Content: So we all know that no amount of hounding or complaining is going to convince AT&T; to stop the madness and unlock the Note 3. However, I think it behooves us to TELL AT&T; what we think of this development (or rather this "Anti-Development" development.Could everyone that has a minute or two please sign the petition to tell AT&T; we are disgusted, and at least let them know that more than a few people are very unhappy right now, and that they are going to lose more than they ever hoped to gain with this kind of thinking.Please don't tell me I am wasting my time, it's mine and I like using some to tell AT&T; what I think. If you don't care to tell them or just want to accept this BS then sit tight, cause more and deeper BS is in the pipeline, brought to you buy the company who's tagline is "Rethink Possible" Right....Petition has about 440 signatures at the moment, but hoping for many more. Every signature sends an email to these AT&T; Executives:Petitioning:  Randall Stephenson AT&T; CEORalph de la Vega;  President and CEO - AT&T; MobilityJohn Donovan; Senior VP, AT&T; Technology and Network OperationsJohn T. Stankey; Group President and Chief Strategy OfficerAT&T;: Unlock OUR Samsung Galaxy Note 3 Bootloader!Please sign this petition to send a message to AT&T;: [...]

Reviews.Title: its okay
Reviews.Author: Al k
Reviews.Content: phone doesnt come in original packaging and no headset thats about all i found wrong with it....the phone works amazing  tho

Reviews.Title: Everything you want in a phone and more
Reviews.Author: Mathias G.
Reviews.Content: There's not much more that I can say about this phone than what others have already stated. It's a great high-end phone that's well worth the money.I'm an iphone user that has been down this android road before. I absolutely hated it the first time around. I failed to realize that with android, you have to find a phone that can withstand the test of time. Your android phone has to have the features and specs to run the most recent android OS, and if your phone didn't cut it then you would be left behind with an older android OS and ultimately an outdated phone.Android is finally getting around to creating a more universal OS called "Kit-Kat" that should make the android OS a more stable environment.The Note 3 is the answer. There's simply nothing this phone can't do. Everyone will have their own special thing that they appreciate about the Note 3. Mine is the fact that it has an IR blaster that can control my TV, Home Theatre System, and Uverse box. I never thought I would use that feature, but honestly it just works and it's simple.Anyways, I just thought I'd give my opinion on this brilliant phone. Everything else you might need to know about this phone or the Android OS it runs on can be easily found in other reviews or online.

Reviews.Title: one and out
Reviews.Author: pauly "music man"
Reviews.Content: this is my first android phone, do I like it?............NO  The battery life is brutal and it really is too big, when I reach to answer a call I'm always hitting the volume or screen button, it's good for watching videos but I rarely ever do. It also seems to be glitchy and doesn't run seamlessly at all. Would I buy again? No way................................and I believe if you drop this behemoth just once it'll be cashed................and considering how cumbersome it is to hold I wonder how long that will take...................only problem was I kept it past the 14 day return policy...................wish I would have sent it back and waited on the iphone 6 next year

Reviews.Title: GARBAGE!!!
Reviews.Author: Reckless Moe
Reviews.Content: I tried two of them. Experienced the same problem with both and it's an ongoing issue. No signal indoors. None, Zero! No voice, no data. Again, two different phones. ATT changed the sim card 3 times; no success. iPhone in the same room with blazing signal. Samsung refueses to take responsibility. They want me to send it in for "Repair!!" The phone is brand new. I'll lose my job for not having a phone for 10 days. $700 phone but they won't admit that some unites are defective. I'm going to sue Samsung. Anyone interested email me at new90113@gmail.comI have tens of screenshots documenting the problem....

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this to use as a phone!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had the GN 1 which lasted fairly well for about a year. The second year was all about suffering through until I was eligible for an upgrade. It finally completely died two weeks after the GN 3 came out. So, because I loved all the features and size of the phablet and assumed the device would be better than my last, I purchased the GN 3. Three days later people started telling me my voice cut out for several seconds while talking to them, then they started complaining there was a loud echo. Since I was within the 14 day return period, I returned the phone and got another new one. That solved the problem temporarily, but a few weeks later I started getting complaints again. I went back to AT&T; and this time they reset the phone which unfortunately made me lose my calendar, but once again the phone seemed to work, at least for a while. Within about six weeks the complaints from my clients and family were coming in several times a day. Another bum phone!! All AT&T; wants to do is send me a refurbished phone under the warranty. I've tried and tried to get them to understand that I paid for a new phone THAT WORKED and I've never gotten that. They really don't care. All they do is read their scripts, tell me they understand, and often hang up on me even though I have been polite (although firm) about my expectations.Fun tablet, terrible phone!!!!

Reviews.Title: Price Cut vs The Hassle.... i dont think its worth it
Reviews.Author: Robert R.
Reviews.Content: DONT EVER BUY A NEW PHONE FROM AMAZON WITH ANY WIRELESS CARRIER. Why? You might seem to be getting the phone at a smaller price but you cant forget about the $100 deposit if your a new customer. And if your uprgading it they will add more money to the price and im not talking the uprgrade fee. THATS NOT EVEN THE BIG PROBLEM. The biggest problem is, them sending me supposedly TWO FAULTY SIM CARDS with the device, then lying to me and sayin that the store could give me another one but they cant. On top of that my NUMBER DIDNT FULLY PORT THROUGH, PHONE DIDNT ACTIVATE (cause Amazon activation instructions dont work and it showed, my SIM wasnt faulty they just dont know how to activate a SIM and AT&T; did thankfully) and to top it all off AT&T; DIDNT GET THE $100 DEPOSIT from Amazon! So they charging me (again). Did i mention the S-Scroll, Smart Pause, and Air gesture dont work on phone? (Although i think a handful of people have that problem too, might be a Samsung thing) THIS IS WHAT YOU DEAL WITH WHEN YOU DONT GET YOUR PHONE DIRECTLY FROM THE WIRELESS CARRIER. Just Amazon and AT&T; customer service pointing fingers at each other sending you in circles for a week to finally get phone activated.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: L. Collins
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for Christmas and I have to say it's a big disappointment. It has an odd set-up, works slowly when pulling up photos/files, has a weird issue with the GPS and just doesn't seem to perform as well as I would have expected. Considering how much my father paid for this I really did expect a higher level of excellence than the Samsung Galaxy Note 3 has to offer. I'm going to give this a little more time just to be sure, but if it doesn't start improving or impressing me soon I'm returning it for an iPhone.

Reviews.Title: I returned this Note 3 (AT&T;)
Reviews.Author: Juan C. Mejia
Reviews.Content: I returned this AT&T; phone, I fully paid for this supposed "Without a Service Plan" phone to use it with a different carrier, but its locked to AT&T; network, and AT&T; will unlock it after you use it 6 month under AT&T; network with prepaid service (GoPhone).

Reviews.Title: stay away from galaxy note 3!!
Reviews.Author: Paul McDonald
Reviews.Content: So, I got this phone using "Verizon Edge" program - ordered over the phone. When I received it, it wouldn't activate. The SIM card number wasn't on the order. I had to pry the SIM card out of the Note 3, which is NOT an easy thing to do! I had to do this to read the SIM card number to Verizon Wireless, so they could activate it.I noticed that when I had device on maximum brightness (NOT on "Automatic") and was working on something over extended amount of time, the brightness would dim for a few seconds, then return to max. This would keep happening, at random intervals, and to seemingly random brightness levels. If I continued still to use it... say after 45 minutes or something, it would dim to MINIMUM brightness for few seconds.Now, it wouldn't show me or tell me in any way what brightness level it was changing to... I could just tell when it was putting to MINIMUM brightness. I got it replaced for another Note 3... The replacement had same issue... I called Verizon Wireless and then they revealed to me that this was a feature built into device by the manufacturer. I even spoke to Samsung to verify this.So, stay away from the Galaxy Note 3 at ALL COSTS! ANYONE that owned this device might need to operate the device on maximum brightness for extended amount of time... I mean, why have a long life battery, quad core cpu, and 3 gb RAM, if you can't fully utilize them? So, this phone does this to prevent overheating. Why would a $700 phone have a problem with overheating!?!STAY AWAY FROM THE GALAXY NOTE 3!

Reviews.Author: santos b. lainez
Reviews.Content: i received the phone when i tried to add my sim card it did not come unlocked and was told to enter a unlock pin

Reviews.Content: Samsung put a region lock on it. It is the worst thing for Samsung phone. If you want to use local sim when you are traveling, forget it...the phone won't accept any sim that is out of the region. I will not buy any phone from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: ANOTHER JUNK PHONE AND OVER PRICE

Reviews.Content: THIS PHONE IS HORRIBLE. I WENT THROUGH 5 NEW REPLACEMENT PHONES IN 3 WEEKS. WHEN I TOUCH THE SCREEN, IT MOVE LEFT OR RIGHT. WHEN I TAKE A PICTURE, IT TOOK SEVERAL SHOT TO GET A CLEAR PICTURE. IT'S  NOT LOUD TO HEAR PHONE CONVERSATION AT RESTAURANTS OR EVENTS. SOUND SYSTEM IS HORRIBLE.SOMETIME WHEN I ANSWER THE PHONE, IT DOES NOT RESPOND.I HAVE TO CONSTANTLY REMOVE BATTERY AND START ALL OVER AGAIN.EVERY TIME I GET NEW PHONE REPLACEMENT. ALL THE SONG PLAYLISTS HAVE TO START ALL OVER AGAIN WHICH TAKES SEVERAL HOURS TO DO IT.
